Tasks.Task Description: Set up a new Azure Storage account to store blobs. This involves selecting the appropriate performance tier, replication strategy, and access tier.
Configure the Blob Storage settings, including setting up containers, access policies, and lifecycle management rules.
Implement access control using Azure RBAC roles or shared access signatures (SAS) to manage permissions for users and applications.
Choose and configure the appropriate data redundancy option (LRS, ZRS, GRS, RA-GRS) to ensure data durability and availability.
Configure monitoring and alerts for Blob Storage using Azure Monitor to track performance, availability, and usage metrics.
Use the Azure pricing calculator to estimate costs and implement cost management features to set budgets and monitor expenses.
Ensure data at rest is encrypted using Azure Storage Service Encryption (SSE) and configure customer-managed keys if required.
Implement data transfer methods such as AzCopy, Azure Data Factory, or Azure Storage Explorer for uploading and managing blobs.
Set up event-based triggers using Azure Event Grid to react to blob storage events like creation, deletion, or modification.
Configure lifecycle management policies to automatically transition blobs to different access tiers or delete them based on specified rules.
Enable logging and diagnostics to capture detailed information about requests to the Blob Storage service for troubleshooting and analysis.
Follow security best practices for Azure Blob Storage, including using private endpoints, firewall rules, and advanced threat protection.
Configure data replication settings to ensure high availability and disaster recovery for your Blob Storage data.
Install and use Azure Blob Storage client libraries for different programming languages (e.g., .NET, Java, Python, JavaScript) to interact with Blob Storage programmatically.
Set up Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) rules to allow web applications from different domains to access Blob Storage resources.
Set up backup and restore procedures for Blob Storage data to ensure data protection and recovery in case of data loss.
Implement data retention policies to manage the lifecycle of your data and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.

Tasks.Task: Set up Blob Storage triggers for Azure Functions
Tasks.Task Description: Configure Blob Storage triggers to automatically execute Azure Functions in response to changes in Blob Storage data.

Tasks.Task: Use Blob Storage with Azure Data Lake
Tasks.Task Description: Integrate Blob Storage with Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 to build scalable data lakes and manage large datasets efficiently.
Set up analytics and reporting for Blob Storage to gain insights into storage usage, performance, and access patterns.
